intro: Bubbia vieillardii, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to survive in dry environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a splash of color to the landscape. Its growth habit is typically low and spreading, forming dense mats that help prevent soil erosion. Bubbia vieillardii is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
